intro: Colymbada jankae, commonly known as the Janka's colymbada, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is distinguished by its striking violet-blue petals and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
